ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I'm not even sure how to describe it, but my writing improved so much from taking this course. Through the assignments, I also learned a lot about my own writing process, as I took the opportunity of this class to try new things and see how they work.

I learned a lot about writing and fiction! Now when I read a book I can't help but pick apart the craft, try to study what the author is doing. This class made me think in a new way, studying how tension developed early on rises into conflict, how to structure a scene, how to make a compelling character, and so on. Also the process of writing and writing and getting that work workshopped was really amazing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The biggest strength of this class is the collaborative aspect. I think I personally benefitted the most from the ability to engage with my classmates' works and to hear their opinions of my work. One weakness is that class often went overtime, so it might have to have more scheduled class time for future semesters.

I really like the workshopping format, the professor's wisdom, the vibe of the class, and the opportunity and openness to write whatever was most interesting to us! I do wish however that more class time was devoted to the readings (maybe shortening the workshops or even just having one work of each student workshopped?) and more outright conversations on craft points. Some things like the different POVs for example (limited, objective), I didn't really know beforehand and wish were clarified and explained during class time. It felt like I was missing a certain foundation of literary terms and concepts I wished I gained!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anybody who has any interest in creative writing. Working with other writers and getting regular feedback is one of the most valuable things when it comes to learning about writing fiction.

I would! It was an absolutely fantastic course, and a great class for students interested in creative writing who want to strengthen this skill. The professor gave so much great individual feedback, and I feel like I've really grown as a creative writer.
